    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

/* Body Styles */
body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    color: #333;
    background-color: #fff;
}

/* Header Styles */
.site-header {
    background-color: #f8f8f8;
    padding: 20px;
}

.site-branding h1 {
    font-size: 24px;
}

.main-navigation .primary-menu {
    list-style: none;
    display: flex;
}

.main-navigation .primary-menu li {
    margin-right: 15px;
}

.main-navigation .primary-menu a {
    text-decoration: none;
    color: #333;
}

/* Footer Styles */
.site-footer {
    background-color: #f8f8f8;
    padding: 20px;
    text-align: center;
}

/* Content Styles */
main {
    padding: 20px;
}

/* Buttons */
.button {
    display: inline-block;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    background-color: #5A9BD5;
    color: #fff;
    text-decoration: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/* Media Queries */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
    .main-navigation .primary-menu {
        flex-direction: column;
    }
}

15. Implementing Custom Functionality

Since you're aiming for functionality similar to the "bark" theme, consider implementing the following features:

  • Custom Post Types: For pets available for adoption.
  • Custom Taxonomies: For pet types, breeds, etc.
  • Custom Fields: To store additional pet information.
  • Template Parts: To organize your theme files better.
  • Theme Customizer: Allow customization of theme options via the WordPress Customizer.

16. Register Custom Post Types and Taxonomies

Add the following code to your functions.php to register a custom post type for pets:

php
// Register Custom Post Type
function tailsadoption_register_pet_cpt() {
    $labels = array(
        'name'                  => _x( 'Pets', 'Post Type General Name', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'singular_name'         => _x( 'Pet', 'Post Type Singular Name', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'menu_name'             => __( 'Pets', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'name_admin_bar'        => __( 'Pet', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'add_new_item'          => __( 'Add New Pet', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'edit_item'             => __( 'Edit Pet', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'view_item'             => __( 'View Pet', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'all_items'             => __( 'All Pets', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'search_items'          => __( 'Search Pets', 'tailsadoption' ),
    );
    $args = array(
        'label'                 => __( 'Pet', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'description'           => __( 'Pets available for adoption', 'tailsadoption' ),
        'labels'                => $labels,
        'supports'              => array( 'title', 'editor', 'thumbnail', 'custom-fields' ),
        'public'                => true,
        'has_archive'           => true,
        'rewrite'               => array( 'slug' => 'pets' ),
        'menu_icon'             => 'dashicons-pets',
    );
    register_post_type( 'pet', $args );
}
add_action( 'init', 'tailsadoption_register_pet_cpt' );

17. Create Templates for Custom Post Types

Create single-pet.php to display individual pet listings.

php
<?php get_header(); ?>

<main>
    <?php if ( have_posts() ) : while ( have_posts() ) : the_post(); ?>
        <article id="pet-<?php the_ID(); ?>" <?php post_class(); ?>>
            <h1><?php the_title(); ?></h1>
            <?php if ( has_post_thumbnail() ) {
                the_post_thumbnail( 'large' );
            } ?>
            <div class="pet-content">
                <?php the_content(); ?>
                <!-- Display custom fields -->
                <p><strong>Age:</strong> <?php echo get_post_meta( get_the_ID(), 'age', true ); ?></p>
                <p><strong>Breed:</strong> <?php echo get_post_meta( get_the_ID(), 'breed', true ); ?></p>
                <!-- Add more fields as needed -->
            </div>
        </article>
    <?php endwhile; else : ?>
        <p><?php _e( 'Sorry, no pets matched your criteria.', 'tailsadoption' ); ?></p>
    <?php endif; ?>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

18. Enhance Your Theme

  • Accessibility: Ensure your theme is accessible to all users.
  • Responsive Design: Use media queries to make your theme mobile-friendly.
  • SEO: Structure your HTML properly for better search engine optimization.
  • Internationalization: Make your theme translation-ready.

19. Activate Your Theme

After uploading all your theme files to the tailsadoption folder:

  1. Log in to your WordPress admin dashboard.
  2. Go to Appearance > Themes.
  3. You should see Tails Adoption Theme listed.
  4. Click Activate.

20. Test Your Theme

  • Check All Pages: Visit different pages and posts to ensure everything displays correctly.
  • Customize: Use the WordPress Customizer to make any adjustments.
  • Validate HTML and CSS: Use validation tools to check for errors.
  • Debugging: Enable WP_DEBUG in wp-config.php during development.

Additional Resources

  • WordPress Theme Handbook: https://developer.wordpress.org/themes/
  • WordPress Coding Standards: https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/
  • Template Hierarchy: https://developer.wordpress.org/themes/basics/template-hierarchy/
  • Function Reference: https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/

Final Notes

  • Avoid Copying Code from "Bark" Theme: While you can be inspired by the design and functionality, ensure that all code is your own or properly licensed.
  • Customization: Feel free to adjust the code to suit your specific needs.
  • Ask for Help: If you encounter issues or have questions, don't hesitate to ask.

Let me know if you need assistance with specific features or further guidance on any of these steps. I'm here to help you build your custom theme successfully!

You said:
awesome work so far. Now, let's only focus on updating only the files that are necessary for providing aesthetics similar to that on trendy modern websites. Provide HTML, PHP, CSS, and/or JavaScript, as either an update to current files in place, or as new files to add, to the themes folder. Since this website won't hold blog functions like the "bark" template suggested, let me know which files that you mentioned in your previous response are not useful for our applications, so I can delete them from the server. do your best to concatenate code so that I am not trying to put blocks of code designated for the same file into one.

Thank you for your feedback!

To focus on providing a modern, trendy aesthetic and streamline your theme, we'll:

  • Identify unnecessary files related to blog functionality so you can delete them.
  • Update essential files with cohesive code for a contemporary design.
  • Provide complete code blocks for each file to avoid confusion.

Files to Delete (Not Useful for Your Application):

Since your website won't have blog functionalities, you can remove:

  • index.php (we'll use front-page.php instead)
  • single.php (handles single blog posts)
  • archive.php (for blog archives)
  • comments.php (if not using comments)
  • sidebar.php (if not using a sidebar)
  • search.php (if not implementing search functionality)
  • 404.php (optional but recommended to keep for error handling)

Essential Files to Keep and Update:

  • style.css
  • functions.php
  • header.php
  • footer.php
  • front-page.php (homepage template)
  • page.php (default page template)
  • Custom page templates:
    • page-home.php (if preferred over front-page.php)
    • page-adopt.php
    • page-rehome.php

Updated Files with Modern Aesthetics:

Below are the complete updated code files.

1. style.css

css
/*
Theme Name: Tails Adoption Theme
Theme URI: https://tailsadoption.org/
Description: Custom theme for Tails Adoption
Author: Your Name
Author URI: https://tailsadoption.org/
Version: 1.0.0
License: GNU General Public License v2 or later
License URI: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html
Text Domain: tailsadoption
*/

/* Reset */
* {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  box-sizing: border-box;
}

/* Variables */
:root {
  --primary-color: #5A9BD5;
  --secondary-color: #A8D08D;
  --accent-color: #FFD966;
  --text-color: #333;
  --background-color: #fff;
  --font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, sans-serif;
}

/* Body Styles */
body {
  font-family: var(--font-family);
  color: var(--text-color);
  background-color: var(--background-color);
  line-height: 1.6;
}

/* Header Styles */
header {
  background-color: var(--secondary-color);
  padding: 20px;
}

header .container {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: space-between;
}

header .logo {
  max-width: 150px;
}

header nav ul {
  list-style: none;
  display: flex;
}

header nav ul li {
  margin-left: 20px;
}

header nav a {
  color: var(--text-color);
  text-decoration: none;
  font-weight: bold;
}

/* Hero Section */
.hero {
  background-color: var(--accent-color);
  text-align: center;
  padding: 80px 20px;
}

.hero h1 {
  font-size: 48px;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.hero p {
  font-size: 24px;
  margin-bottom: 30px;
}

.hero .btn {
  background-color: var(--primary-color);
  color: #fff;
  padding: 15px 30px;
  text-decoration: none;
  border-radius: 5px;
}

/* Footer Styles */
footer {
  background-color: var(--secondary-color);
  text-align: center;
  padding: 20px;
  margin-top: 40px;
}

footer p {
  color: var(--text-color);
}

/* Responsive Design */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  header .container {
    flex-direction: column;
  }

  header nav ul {
    flex-direction: column;
    margin-top: 10px;
  }

  header nav ul li {
    margin-left: 0;
    margin-bottom: 10px;
  }

  .hero h1 {
    font-size: 36px;
  }

  .hero p {
    font-size: 18px;
  }
}

/* Buttons */
.btn {
  background-color: var(--primary-color);
  color: #fff;
  padding: 15px 30px;
  text-decoration: none;
  border-radius: 5px;
}

/* Links */
a {
  color: var(--primary-color);
}

a:hover {
  text-decoration: underline;
}

2. functions.php

php
<?php
// Theme setup
function tailsadoption_setup() {
  // Enable support for document title tag
  add_theme_support( 'title-tag' );

  // Enable support for Post Thumbnails
  add_theme_support( 'post-thumbnails' );

  // Register navigation menus
  register_nav_menus( array(
    'primary' => __( 'Primary Menu', 'tailsadoption' ),
  ) );
}
add_action( 'after_setup_theme', 'tailsadoption_setup' );

// Enqueue scripts and styles
function tailsadoption_scripts() {
  wp_enqueue_style( 'tailsadoption-style', get_stylesheet_uri() );

  // Enqueue custom JavaScript if needed
  // wp_enqueue_script( 'tailsadoption-script', get_template_directory_uri() . '/js/main.js', array(), null, true );
}
add_action( 'wp_enqueue_scripts', 'tailsadoption_scripts' );
?>

3. header.php

php
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html <?php language_attributes(); ?>>
<head>
  <meta charset="<?php bloginfo( 'charset' ); ?>">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
  <?php wp_head(); ?>
</head>
<body <?php body_class(); ?>>
<header>
  <div class="container">
    <a href="<?php echo home_url(); ?>">
      <img src="<?php echo get_template_directory_uri(); ?>/images/logo.png" alt="Tails Adoption" class="logo">
    </a>
    <nav>
      <?php
      wp_nav_menu( array(
        'theme_location' => 'primary',
        'container' => '',
        'menu_class' => '',
      ) );
      ?>
    </nav>
  </div>
</header>

Note: Ensure you have a logo.png image in the images directory of your theme.

4. footer.php

php
<footer>
  <div class="container">
    <p>&copy; <?php echo date('Y'); ?> Tails Adoption. All rights reserved.</p>
  </div>
</footer>
<?php wp_footer(); ?>
</body>
</html>

5. front-page.php

php
<?php
get_header();
?>

<main>
  <!-- Hero Section -->
  <section class="hero">
    <h1>Welcome to Tails Adoption</h1>
    <p>Your new best friend is waiting for you!</p>
    <a href="<?php echo site_url('/adopt'); ?>" class="btn">Find a Pet</a>
  </section>

  <!-- Additional sections (e.g., Featured Pets, About Us) can be added here -->
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

6. page-adopt.php

php
<?php
/* Template Name: Adopt Page */
get_header();
?>

<main>
  <section class="adopt">
    <h1>Available Pets for Adoption</h1>
    <!-- Display pet listings -->
    <?php
    $args = array(
      'post_type' => 'pet',
      'posts_per_page' => -1,
    );
    $pets = new WP_Query( $args );
    if ( $pets->have_posts() ) :
    ?>
      <div class="pet-listings">
        <?php while ( $pets->have_posts() ) : $pets->the_post(); ?>
          <div class="pet-card">
            <?php if ( has_post_thumbnail() ) : ?>
              <a href="<?php the_permalink(); ?>">
                <?php the_post_thumbnail( 'medium' ); ?>
              </a>
            <?php endif; ?>
            <h2><a href="<?php the_permalink(); ?>"><?php the_title(); ?></a></h2>
          </div>
        <?php endwhile; wp_reset_postdata(); ?>
      </div>
    <?php else : ?>
      <p>No pets available at the moment. Please check back later.</p>
    <?php endif; ?>
  </section>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

7. page-rehome.php

php
<?php
/* Template Name: Rehome Page */
get_header();
?>

<main>
  <section class="rehome">
    <h1>Rehome Your Pet</h1>
    <!-- Rehoming form -->
    <?php if ( is_user_logged_in() ) : ?>
      <form method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data">
        <!-- Form fields for pet details -->
        <label for="pet_name">Pet Name</label>
        <input type="text" name="pet_name" id="pet_name" required>

        <!-- Additional fields (type, age, description, etc.) -->

        <label for="pet_image">Pet Image</label>
        <input type="file" name="pet_image" id="pet_image" required>

        <input type="submit" name="submit_pet" value="Submit">
      </form>

      <?php
      // Handle form submission
      if ( isset( $_POST['submit_pet'] ) ) {
        // Sanitize and process form data
        // Insert new pet post
        // Handle file upload
      }
      ?>
    <?php else : ?>
      <p>Please <a href="<?php echo wp_login_url( get_permalink() ); ?>">log in</a> to rehome your pet.</p>
    <?php endif; ?>
  </section>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

8. page.php

php
<?php
get_header();
if ( have_posts() ) : while ( have_posts() ) : the_post();
?>

<main>
  <section class="page-content">
    <h1><?php the_title(); ?></h1>
    <?php the_content(); ?>
  </section>
</main>

<?php
endwhile; endif;
get_footer();
?>

9. functions.php (Additional Code for Custom Post Type)

Add this to your functions.php to register the 'pet' custom post type.

php
// Register Custom Post Type 'pet'
function tailsadoption_register_pet_cpt() {
  $labels = array(
    'name' => 'Pets',
    'singular_name' => 'Pet',
  );
  $args = array(
    'label' => 'Pets',
    'labels' => $labels,
    'public' => true,
    'supports' => array( 'title', 'editor', 'thumbnail' ),
    'has_archive' => true,
    'rewrite' => array( 'slug' => 'pets' ),
  );
  register_post_type( 'pet', $args );
}
add_action( 'init', 'tailsadoption_register_pet_cpt' );

10. style.css (Additional Styles for Pet Listings)

css
/* Pet Listings */
.pet-listings {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  justify-content: center;
}

.pet-card {
  width: 300px;
  margin: 15px;
  text-align: center;
}

.pet-card img {
  width: 100%;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

.pet-card h2 {
  margin-top: 10px;
  font-size: 24px;
}

11. Optional JavaScript (main.js)

If you need interactivity (e.g., a mobile menu toggle), create a main.js file:

javascript
// main.js

document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
  const menuToggle = document.querySelector('.menu-toggle');
  const navMenu = document.querySelector('nav ul');

  menuToggle.addEventListener('click', function() {
    navMenu.classList.toggle('show');
  });
});

Update header.php to include the menu toggle button:

html
<!-- Add this inside the header container -->
<button class="menu-toggle">Menu</button>

Next Steps:

  • Implement the provided code by updating your theme files accordingly.
  • Customize content and styles to match your brand identity.
  • Test your website across different devices and browsers for responsiveness and functionality.
  • Add images and media to enhance the visual appeal.
  • Ensure accessibility by following best practices (e.g., alt attributes for images).

Feel free to reach out if you need further assistance or have any questions!

You said:
Awesome work. For your information, have deleted index.php, single.php, archive.php, comments.php, sidebar.php, and we had never created search.php. i have, in the folder "tailsadoption" as you coded them, the php files: 404, footer, front-page, functions, header, page-adopt, page-home, page-rehome, page, single-pet; the css file style; the javascript file main; and a folder containing logo.png. Now we're ready to start working on one, some, or all of the functions for the three primary webpages as we were discussing in our first few messages, but now tailored in a fashion that minimizes reliance on wordpress plugins, since we have full control of web development. I'll let you decide where we begin.

**Great progress so far! I'm glad we've set up the foundational files for your custom theme. Now, let's focus on implementing the functionalities for your three primary webpages—Home, Adopt, and Rehome—while minimizing reliance on WordPress plugins. Since we have full control over the development, we can use custom code to achieve the desired features.

Overview

We'll proceed in the following order:

  1. Implement the "Rehome" Page:

    • Create a custom form for users to submit pet listings.
    • Handle form submissions securely.
    • Save submitted data as custom post entries.

  2. Implement the "Adopt" Page:

    • Display pet listings from the custom post type.
    • Provide filtering and search functionality.

  3. Enhance the "Home" Page:

    • Highlight featured pets.
    • Add sections that encourage user engagement.

1. Implementing the "Rehome" Page

Objective

Allow users to submit information about pets they wish to rehome through a custom form, and save this data as entries in a custom post type called "Pet".

Steps

  1. Create or Update the Custom Post Type "Pet"
  2. Create the Submission Form in page-rehome.php
  3. Handle Form Submissions Securely
  4. Validate and Sanitize User Input
  5. Save Data to the Database
  6. Provide Feedback to the User

1.1. Create or Update the Custom Post Type "Pet"

Ensure that the custom post type "Pet" is registered in your functions.php file.

Add or Update the Following Code in functions.php:

php
// Register Custom Post Type 'Pet'
function tailsadoption_register_pet_cpt() {
    $labels = array(
        'name'                  => 'Pets',
        'singular_name'         => 'Pet',
        'menu_name'             => 'Pets',
        'name_admin_bar'        => 'Pet',
        'add_new'               => 'Add New',
        'add_new_item'          => 'Add New Pet',
        'new_item'              => 'New Pet',
        'edit_item'             => 'Edit Pet',
        'view_item'             => 'View Pet',
        'all_items'             => 'All Pets',
        'search_items'          => 'Search Pets',
        'not_found'             => 'No pets found.',
    );
    $args = array(
        'label'                 => 'Pet',
        'labels'                => $labels,
        'public'                => true,
        'supports'              => array( 'title', 'editor', 'author', 'thumbnail' ),
        'has_archive'           => true,
        'rewrite'               => array( 'slug' => 'pets' ),
        'show_in_rest'          => true, // Enables Gutenberg editor support
    );
    register_post_type( 'pet', $args );
}
add_action( 'init', 'tailsadoption_register_pet_cpt' );

1.2. Create the Submission Form in page-rehome.php

We'll create a custom page template for the "Rehome" page, allowing logged-in users to submit pet information.

Update page-rehome.php with the Following Code:

php
<?php
/* Template Name: Rehome Page */

get_header();
?>

<main>
    <section class="rehome">
        <h1>Rehome Your Pet</h1>
        <?php if ( is_user_logged_in() ) : ?>
            <?php
            // Check if the form is submitted
            if ( $_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] == 'POST' && isset( $_POST['submit_pet'] ) ) {
                // Handle form submission (we'll cover this in the next step)
            } else {
                // Display the form
                ?>
                <form method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data">
                    <?php wp_nonce_field( 'pet_submission', 'pet_nonce' ); ?>

                    <label for="pet_name">Pet Name</label>
                    <input type="text" name="pet_name" id="pet_name" required>

                    <label for="pet_type">Type of Animal</label>
                    <select name="pet_type" id="pet_type" required>
                        <option value="">Select Type</option>
                        <option value="Dog">Dog</option>
                        <option value="Cat">Cat</option>
                        <option value="Bird">Bird</option>
                        <!-- Add more options as needed -->
                    </select>

                    <label for="pet_age">Age</label>
                    <input type="number" name="pet_age" id="pet_age" min="0" required>

                    <label for="pet_description">Description</label>
                    <textarea name="pet_description" id="pet_description" required></textarea>

                    <label for="pet_image">Pet Image</label>
                    <input type="file" name="pet_image" id="pet_image" accept="image/*" required>

                    <input type="submit" name="submit_pet" value="Submit">
                </form>
                <?php
            }
            ?>
        <?php else : ?>
            <p>Please <a href="<?php echo wp_login_url( get_permalink() ); ?>">log in</a> to rehome your pet.</p>
        <?php endif; ?>
    </section>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

Explanation:

  • The form includes fields for pet name, type, age, description, and image.
  • wp_nonce_field() is used for security to prevent CSRF attacks.
  • The form checks if the user is logged in; if not, it prompts them to log in.

1.3. Handle Form Submissions Securely

Now, we'll handle the form submission by processing the data and saving it as a new "Pet" post.

Add the Following Code Inside the if Statement Checking for Form Submission in page-rehome.php:

php
if ( $_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] == 'POST' && isset( $_POST['submit_pet'] ) ) {
    // Verify nonce
    if ( ! isset( $_POST['pet_nonce'] ) || ! wp_verify_nonce( $_POST['pet_nonce'], 'pet_submission' ) ) {
        echo '<p>Error: Invalid form submission. Please try again.</p>';
    } else {
        // Validate and sanitize user input
        $pet_name        = sanitize_text_field( $_POST['pet_name'] );
        $pet_type        = sanitize_text_field( $_POST['pet_type'] );
        $pet_age         = intval( $_POST['pet_age'] );
        $pet_description = sanitize_textarea_field( $_POST['pet_description'] );

        // Handle file upload
        if ( ! function_exists( 'wp_handle_upload' ) ) {
            require_once( ABSPATH . 'wp-admin/includes/file.php' );
        }

        $uploadedfile = $_FILES['pet_image'];
        $upload_overrides = array( 'test_form' => false );

        $movefile = wp_handle_upload( $uploadedfile, $upload_overrides );

        if ( $movefile && ! isset( $movefile['error'] ) ) {
            // File is uploaded successfully

            // Create new pet post
            $new_pet = array(
                'post_title'   => $pet_name,
                'post_content' => $pet_description,
                'post_status'  => 'pending', // Set to 'pending' for admin approval
                'post_type'    => 'pet',
                'post_author'  => get_current_user_id(),
            );

            $post_id = wp_insert_post( $new_pet );

            if ( $post_id ) {
                // Set pet type and age as post meta
                update_post_meta( $post_id, 'pet_type', $pet_type );
                update_post_meta( $post_id, 'pet_age', $pet_age );

                // Attach uploaded image to the post
                $attachment = array(
                    'guid'           => $movefile['url'],
                    'post_mime_type' => $movefile['type'],
                    'post_title'     => sanitize_file_name( $movefile['file'] ),
                    'post_content'   => '',
                    'post_status'    => 'inherit',
                );

                $attach_id = wp_insert_attachment( $attachment, $movefile['file'], $post_id );

                // Generate attachment metadata
                require_once( ABSPATH . 'wp-admin/includes/image.php' );
                $attach_data = wp_generate_attachment_metadata( $attach_id, $movefile['file'] );
                wp_update_attachment_metadata( $attach_id, $attach_data );

                // Set the featured image (post thumbnail)
                set_post_thumbnail( $post_id, $attach_id );

                echo '<p>Thank you! Your pet listing has been submitted for review.</p>';
            } else {
                echo '<p>Error: Unable to create pet listing. Please try again.</p>';
            }
        } else {
            // Handle upload error
            echo '<p>Error uploading image: ' . $movefile['error'] . '</p>';
        }
    }
}

Explanation:

  • Nonce Verification: Ensures the form submission is legitimate.
  • Input Sanitization: Cleans the user input to prevent malicious data.
  • File Upload Handling:
    • Checks if the file was uploaded without errors.
    • Uses wp_handle_upload to manage the upload.
  • Creating a New Post:
    • Creates a new "Pet" post with status 'pending' for admin review.
    • Associates the uploaded image as the featured image.
    • Stores additional pet details using update_post_meta.

1.4. Validate and Sanitize User Input

We have already sanitized the input in the above code using:

  • sanitize_text_field() for text inputs.
  • sanitize_textarea_field() for textarea inputs.
  • intval() for numeric inputs.

Ensure that all user inputs are sanitized before processing.

1.5. Save Data to the Database

Data is saved as:

  • Post Data:
    • post_title: Pet name.
    • post_content: Pet description.
    • post_status: Set to 'pending' for moderation.
    • post_type: 'pet'.
  • Post Meta:
    • pet_type: Type of animal.
    • pet_age: Age of the pet.

1.6. Provide Feedback to the User

After submission, we display a message to the user:

  • On success: "Thank you! Your pet listing has been submitted for review."
  • On error: Appropriate error messages.

1.7. Admin Moderation

Since the posts are set to 'pending' status, an admin can review and publish them.

2. Implementing the "Adopt" Page

Objective

Display the list of available pets for adoption from the "Pet" custom post type, allowing users to view details and contact the owner.

Steps

  1. Create the Template for the "Adopt" Page
  2. Query and Display Pet Listings
  3. Create a Single Pet Template
  4. Enhance the Display with Styling

2.1. Create the Template for the "Adopt" Page

Update page-adopt.php with the Following Code:

php
<?php
/* Template Name: Adopt Page */

get_header();
?>

<main>
    <section class="adopt">
        <h1>Available Pets for Adoption</h1>
        <?php
        $args = array(
            'post_type'      => 'pet',
            'post_status'    => 'publish',
            'posts_per_page' => -1,
        );
        $pets = new WP_Query( $args );
        if ( $pets->have_posts() ) :
        ?>
            <div class="pet-listings">
                <?php while ( $pets->have_posts() ) : $pets->the_post(); ?>
                    <div class="pet-card">
                        <a href="<?php the_permalink(); ?>">
                            <?php if ( has_post_thumbnail() ) : ?>
                                <?php the_post_thumbnail( 'medium' ); ?>
                            <?php else : ?>
                                <img src="<?php echo get_template_directory_uri(); ?>/images/default-pet.png" alt="<?php the_title(); ?>">
                            <?php endif; ?>
                            <h2><?php the_title(); ?></h2>
                            <p>Type: <?php echo esc_html( get_post_meta( get_the_ID(), 'pet_type', true ) ); ?></p>
                            <p>Age: <?php echo intval( get_post_meta( get_the_ID(), 'pet_age', true ) ); ?> years</p>
                        </a>
                    </div>
                <?php endwhile; wp_reset_postdata(); ?>
            </div>
        <?php else : ?>
            <p>No pets available at the moment. Please check back later.</p>
        <?php endif; ?>
    </section>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

Explanation:

  • Query Parameters:
    • post_type: 'pet'.
    • post_status: 'publish' (only show approved listings).
  • Display Fields:
    • Pet image, name, type, and age.
  • Fallback Image:
    • If no featured image, display a default image.

2.2. Create a Single Pet Template

Create single-pet.php to display individual pet details.

Create or Update single-pet.php with the Following Code:

php
<?php
get_header();
?>

<main>
    <?php if ( have_posts() ) : while ( have_posts() ) : the_post(); ?>
        <article class="pet-details">
            <h1><?php the_title(); ?></h1>
            <div class="pet-meta">
                <p>Type: <?php echo esc_html( get_post_meta( get_the_ID(), 'pet_type', true ) ); ?></p>
                <p>Age: <?php echo intval( get_post_meta( get_the_ID(), 'pet_age', true ) ); ?> years</p>
            </div>
            <?php if ( has_post_thumbnail() ) : ?>
                <?php the_post_thumbnail( 'large' ); ?>
            <?php endif; ?>
            <div class="pet-description">
                <?php the_content(); ?>
            </div>
            <div class="contact-owner">
                <h2>Contact Information</h2>
                <?php
                $author_id = get_the_author_meta( 'ID' );
                $author_email = get_the_author_meta( 'user_email' );
                ?>
                <p>Name: <?php echo esc_html( get_the_author_meta( 'display_name' ) ); ?></p>
                <p>Email: <a href="mailto:<?php echo antispambot( $author_email ); ?>"><?php echo antispambot( $author_email ); ?></a></p>
            </div>
        </article>
    <?php endwhile; endif; ?>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

Explanation:

  • Pet Details:
    • Displays the pet's name, type, age, and description.
  • Contact Information:
    • Shows the post author's (pet owner's) name and email.
  • Security:
    • Uses antispambot() to obfuscate the email address.

2.3. Enhance the Display with Styling

Add the Following Styles to style.css:

css
/* Pet Listings */
.pet-listings {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  justify-content: center;
}

.pet-card {
  width: 300px;
  margin: 15px;
  text-align: center;
  background-color: #f9f9f9;
  padding: 15px;
  border-radius: 8px;
  box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.pet-card img {
  width: 100%;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

.pet-card h2 {
  margin-top: 10px;
  font-size: 24px;
}

.pet-card p {
  margin: 5px 0;
}

/* Single Pet Details */
.pet-details {
  max-width: 800px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 20px;
}

.pet-details h1 {
  font-size: 36px;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.pet-meta p {
  font-size: 18px;
  margin: 5px 0;
}

.pet-description {
  margin-top: 20px;
}

.contact-owner {
  margin-top: 40px;
  background-color: #e9f7ef;
  padding: 20px;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

.contact-owner h2 {
  margin-bottom: 15px;
}

3. Enhancing the "Home" Page

Objective

Create an engaging home page that highlights featured pets and encourages users to explore the site.

Steps

  1. Update front-page.php to Include Featured Pets
  2. Add Additional Sections (e.g., About Us, Call to Action)
  3. Style the Home Page

3.1. Update front-page.php to Include Featured Pets

Update front-page.php with the Following Code:

php
<?php
get_header();
?>

<main>
  <!-- Hero Section -->
  <section class="hero">
    <h1>Welcome to Tails Adoption</h1>
    <p>Your new best friend is waiting for you!</p>
    <a href="<?php echo site_url('/adopt'); ?>" class="btn">Find a Pet</a>
  </section>

  <!-- Featured Pets Section -->
  <section class="featured-pets">
    <h2>Featured Pets</h2>
    <?php
    $args = array(
      'post_type'      => 'pet',
      'post_status'    => 'publish',
      'posts_per_page' => 3,
      'orderby'        => 'rand',
    );
    $featured_pets = new WP_Query( $args );
    if ( $featured_pets->have_posts() ) :
    ?>
      <div class="pet-listings">
        <?php while ( $featured_pets->have_posts() ) : $featured_pets->the_post(); ?>
          <div class="pet-card">
            <a href="<?php the_permalink(); ?>">
              <?php if ( has_post_thumbnail() ) : ?>
                <?php the_post_thumbnail( 'medium' ); ?>
              <?php else : ?>
                <img src="<?php echo get_template_directory_uri(); ?>/images/default-pet.png" alt="<?php the_title(); ?>">
              <?php endif; ?>
              <h2><?php the_title(); ?></h2>
              <p>Type: <?php echo esc_html( get_post_meta( get_the_ID(), 'pet_type', true ) ); ?></p>
            </a>
          </div>
        <?php endwhile; wp_reset_postdata(); ?>
      </div>
    <?php else : ?>
      <p>No featured pets available at the moment.</p>
    <?php endif; ?>
  </section>

  <!-- About Us Section -->
  <section class="about-us">
    <h2>About Tails Adoption</h2>
    <p>We are dedicated to connecting loving pets with caring owners. Whether you're looking to adopt or need to find a new home for your pet, we're here to help.</p>
    <a href="<?php echo site_url('/about'); ?>" class="btn">Learn More</a>
  </section>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

3.2. Style the Home Page

Add the Following Styles to style.css:

css
/* Featured Pets Section */
.featured-pets {
  padding: 60px 20px;
  background-color: #f0f8ff;
  text-align: center;
}

.featured-pets h2 {
  font-size: 32px;
  margin-bottom: 40px;
}

/* About Us Section */
.about-us {
  padding: 60px 20px;
  background-color: #fff;
  text-align: center;
}

.about-us h2 {
  font-size: 32px;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.about-us p {
  font-size: 18px;
  max-width: 800px;
  margin: 0 auto 30px;
}

/* Buttons in Sections */
.section .btn {
  margin-top: 20px;
}

4. Additional Enhancements

4.1. Navigation Menu

Ensure your navigation menu includes links to the primary pages:

  • Home
  • Adopt
  • Rehome
  • About Us
  • Contact

Update the Menu in WordPress Admin:

  • Go to Appearance > Menus.
  • Create a new menu named "Primary Menu".
  • Add the desired pages.
  • Assign the menu to the "Primary Menu" location.

4.2. User Registration and Login

Since we're minimizing plugin use, we'll use WordPress's built-in registration and login pages.

  • Registration URL: https://yourdomain.com/wp-login.php?action=register
  • Login URL: https://yourdomain.com/wp-login.php

Optional: Create custom registration and login pages if desired.

4.3. Custom Fields for Additional Pet Information

To add more details about pets, we can use WordPress's built-in custom fields.

Add Custom Fields in page-rehome.php Form:

  • Add new form fields (e.g., sex, breed, vaccinations).
  • Update the form handling code to save these fields using update_post_meta().

Example:

php
// In the form
<label for="pet_sex">Sex</label>
<select name="pet_sex" id="pet_sex" required>
    <option value="">Select Sex</option>
    <option value="Male">Male</option>
    <option value="Female">Female</option>
</select>

// In the form handling code
$pet_sex = sanitize_text_field( $_POST['pet_sex'] );
update_post_meta( $post_id, 'pet_sex', $pet_sex );

Display the Custom Fields in single-pet.php:

php
<p>Sex: <?php echo esc_html( get_post_meta( get_the_ID(), 'pet_sex', true ) ); ?></p>

4.4. Security Enhancements

  • Use Nonces: Already implemented in form handling.
  • Input Validation: Ensure all inputs are validated and sanitized.
  • File Upload Restrictions:
    • Limit file types to images only.
    • Set maximum file size.

Modify File Upload Handling:

php
$allowed_file_types = array( 'jpg', 'jpeg', 'png', 'gif' );
$file_extension = pathinfo( $uploadedfile['name'], PATHINFO_EXTENSION );

if ( ! in_array( strtolower( $file_extension ), $allowed_file_types ) ) {
    echo '<p>Error: Only JPG, JPEG, PNG, and GIF files are allowed.</p>';
    return;
}

$max_file_size = 2 * 1024 * 1024; // 2 MB
if ( $uploadedfile['size'] > $max_file_size ) {
    echo '<p>Error: File size exceeds 2 MB limit.</p>';
    return;
}

5. Testing and Deployment

5.1. Test Each Feature Thoroughly

  • Form Submission:
    • Test submitting a new pet listing.
    • Check if the data is saved correctly.
  • Pet Listings Display:
    • Verify that published pet listings appear on the "Adopt" page.
  • Single Pet Page:
    • Ensure all pet details are displayed accurately.
  • User Experience:
    • Test the site on different devices and browsers.
  • Error Handling:
    • Check how the site behaves with invalid inputs or errors.

5.2. SEO and Accessibility

  • SEO:
    • Use proper HTML tags (e.g., heading hierarchy).
    • Set meta descriptions for pages.
  • Accessibility:
    • Add alt attributes to images.
    • Ensure sufficient color contrast.
    • Test with keyboard navigation.

6. Next Steps

  • Implement Search and Filtering:
    • Allow users to search for pets by type, age, etc.
  • User Account Management:
    • Provide users with a dashboard to manage their listings.
  • Email Notifications:
    • Notify admins of new submissions.
    • Send confirmation emails to users.

Conclusion

By following the steps above, we've implemented the core functionalities for your three primary webpages without relying on additional plugins. This approach gives you full control over your site's features and ensures a lightweight, efficient website.

Feel free to ask if you need further assistance or have any questions about the implementation. I'm here to help you bring your vision to life!

You said:
concatenate both code blocks for page-rehome.php into one code block that I can easily copy and paste

Certainly! Here's the complete code for page-rehome.php with both code blocks combined. You can copy and paste this code into your theme's page-rehome.php file.

php
<?php
/* Template Name: Rehome Page */

get_header();
?>

<main>
    <section class="rehome">
        <h1>Rehome Your Pet</h1>
        <?php if ( is_user_logged_in() ) : ?>
            <?php
            // Check if the form is submitted
            if ( $_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] == 'POST' && isset( $_POST['submit_pet'] ) ) {
                // Verify nonce
                if ( ! isset( $_POST['pet_nonce'] ) || ! wp_verify_nonce( $_POST['pet_nonce'], 'pet_submission' ) ) {
                    echo '<p>Error: Invalid form submission. Please try again.</p>';
                } else {
                    // Validate and sanitize user input
                    $pet_name        = sanitize_text_field( $_POST['pet_name'] );
                    $pet_type        = sanitize_text_field( $_POST['pet_type'] );
                    $pet_age         = intval( $_POST['pet_age'] );
                    $pet_description = sanitize_textarea_field( $_POST['pet_description'] );

                    // Handle file upload
                    if ( ! function_exists( 'wp_handle_upload' ) ) {
                        require_once( ABSPATH . 'wp-admin/includes/file.php' );
                    }

                    $uploadedfile = $_FILES['pet_image'];
                    $upload_overrides = array( 'test_form' => false );

                    // Validate file type and size
                    $allowed_file_types = array( 'jpg', 'jpeg', 'png', 'gif' );
                    $file_extension = pathinfo( $uploadedfile['name'], PATHINFO_EXTENSION );

                    if ( ! in_array( strtolower( $file_extension ), $allowed_file_types ) ) {
                        echo '<p>Error: Only JPG, JPEG, PNG, and GIF files are allowed.</p>';
                        return;
                    }

                    $max_file_size = 2 * 1024 * 1024; // 2 MB
                    if ( $uploadedfile['size'] > $max_file_size ) {
                        echo '<p>Error: File size exceeds 2 MB limit.</p>';
                        return;
                    }

                    $movefile = wp_handle_upload( $uploadedfile, $upload_overrides );

                    if ( $movefile && ! isset( $movefile['error'] ) ) {
                        // File is uploaded successfully

                        // Create new pet post
                        $new_pet = array(
                            'post_title'   => $pet_name,
                            'post_content' => $pet_description,
                            'post_status'  => 'pending', // Set to 'pending' for admin approval
                            'post_type'    => 'pet',
                            'post_author'  => get_current_user_id(),
                        );

                        $post_id = wp_insert_post( $new_pet );

                        if ( $post_id ) {
                            // Set pet type and age as post meta
                            update_post_meta( $post_id, 'pet_type', $pet_type );
                            update_post_meta( $post_id, 'pet_age', $pet_age );

                            // Attach uploaded image to the post
                            $attachment = array(
                                'guid'           => $movefile['url'],
                                'post_mime_type' => $movefile['type'],
                                'post_title'     => sanitize_file_name( $movefile['file'] ),
                                'post_content'   => '',
                                'post_status'    => 'inherit',
                            );

                            $attach_id = wp_insert_attachment( $attachment, $movefile['file'], $post_id );

                            // Generate attachment metadata
                            require_once( ABSPATH . 'wp-admin/includes/image.php' );
                            $attach_data = wp_generate_attachment_metadata( $attach_id, $movefile['file'] );
                            wp_update_attachment_metadata( $attach_id, $attach_data );

                            // Set the featured image (post thumbnail)
                            set_post_thumbnail( $post_id, $attach_id );

                            echo '<p>Thank you! Your pet listing has been submitted for review.</p>';
                        } else {
                            echo '<p>Error: Unable to create pet listing. Please try again.</p>';
                        }
                    } else {
                        // Handle upload error
                        echo '<p>Error uploading image: ' . $movefile['error'] . '</p>';
                    }
                }
            } else {
                // Display the form
                ?>
                <form method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data">
                    <?php wp_nonce_field( 'pet_submission', 'pet_nonce' ); ?>

                    <label for="pet_name">Pet Name</label>
                    <input type="text" name="pet_name" id="pet_name" required>

                    <label for="pet_type">Type of Animal</label>
                    <select name="pet_type" id="pet_type" required>
                        <option value="">Select Type</option>
                        <option value="Dog">Dog</option>
                        <option value="Cat">Cat</option>
                        <option value="Bird">Bird</option>
                        <option value="Reptile">Reptile</option>
                        <option value="Other">Other</option>
                    </select>

                    <label for="pet_age">Age (in years)</label>
                    <input type="number" name="pet_age" id="pet_age" min="0" required>

                    <label for="pet_description">Description</label>
                    <textarea name="pet_description" id="pet_description" required></textarea>

                    <label for="pet_image">Pet Image</label>
                    <input type="file" name="pet_image" id="pet_image" accept="image/*" required>

                    <input type="submit" name="submit_pet" value="Submit">
                </form>
                <?php
            }
            ?>
        <?php else : ?>
            <p>Please <a href="<?php echo wp_login_url( get_permalink() ); ?>">log in</a> to rehome your pet.</p>
        <?php endif; ?>
    </section>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

Notes:

  • File Validation Enhancements: The code includes validation for file type and size to enhance security.
  • Nonce Verification: A nonce field is used to protect against CSRF attacks.
  • Input Sanitization: All user inputs are sanitized using appropriate WordPress functions.
  • Post Status: New pet listings are set to 'pending' status for admin approval before being published.
  • Error Handling: The code provides user feedback for various error scenarios.

Remember to:

  • Create the 'Pet' Custom Post Type in your functions.php if you haven't already.
  • Test the Form Submission thoroughly to ensure it's working as expected.
  • Adjust the Form Fields as needed to capture all the information you require.

Let me know if you need any further assistance!

You said:
I have also deleted "page-home.php" since "front-page.php" is our file for the home page. I have saved all of the code into their proper filenames. I currently have all of the files under the directory "/tailsadoption.org/public_html/wp-content/themes/tailsadoption". I assume certain files are supposed to be moved to somewhere else, is that right? because currently, when I test the home page to my domain, "https://tailsadoption.org/", it only displays: """ My WordPress Sample Page No posts found. Add widgets to the sidebar in your WordPress admin. © 2024 Tails Adoption. All rights reserved. Sample Page """ Where "My WordPress" is a hyperlink that links to "https://tailsadoption.org/" and "Sample page" is hyperlink that links to "https://tailsadoption.org/sample-page/". I think my next step for troubleshooting is figuring out how to get the webpages we created to display appropriately.

Thank you for the detailed information. Let's work together to troubleshoot and resolve the issue so that your website displays as intended.

Understanding the Issue

You're experiencing the following:

  • Website Output: When visiting https://tailsadoption.org/, you're seeing:

    css
    My WordPress
Sample Page
No posts found.

Add widgets to the sidebar in your WordPress admin.

© 2024 Tails Adoption. All rights reserved.

Sample Page

  • Current Theme Files: You've placed all the theme files under /wp-content/themes/tailsadoption.

  • Deleted Files: You've deleted page-home.php since front-page.php serves as the home page template.

Possible Causes

  1. Theme Not Activated: The custom theme may not be activated in WordPress.

  2. Incorrect File Placement: Theme files may be in the wrong directory or subdirectory.

  3. Template Hierarchy Issues: WordPress might not be recognizing front-page.php due to settings.

  4. Missing or Incorrect Code: There may be errors or omissions in your theme files.

  5. WordPress Settings Misconfiguration: Reading settings might not be set correctly.

  6. Caching Issues: Cached data might be preventing the latest changes from displaying.

Step-by-Step Troubleshooting

Let's address each potential cause systematically.

1. Verify That Your Custom Theme Is Activated

Action:

  1. Log in to Your WordPress Admin Dashboard

    • Navigate to https://tailsadoption.org/wp-admin/.

  2. Go to Appearance > Themes

    • In the left-hand menu, click on Appearance, then Themes.

  3. Check for Your Theme

    • Look for Tails Adoption Theme in the list of available themes.

  4. Activate the Theme

    • If it's not already active, hover over Tails Adoption Theme and click Activate.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: If the default theme is active, your custom templates won't be used.
  • Expected Outcome: Activating your custom theme should apply your templates and styles.

2. Ensure Theme Files Are in the Correct Directory

Action:

  1. Check Theme Directory Structure

    • Correct Path: /wp-content/themes/tailsadoption/

    • Files Should Be Directly Inside tailsadoption:

      markdown
      tailsadoption/
  - style.css
  - functions.php
  - header.php
  - footer.php
  - front-page.php
  - page-adopt.php
  - page-rehome.php
  - single-pet.php
  - 404.php
  - main.js
  - images/
    - logo.png
    - default-pet.png (if used)

  2. Avoid Nested Folders

    • Ensure there are no additional subfolders containing your theme files unless necessary (e.g., images, js, css).

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: If files are in subdirectories or misnamed, WordPress may not recognize them.
  • Expected Outcome: Correct placement allows WordPress to load your templates.

3. Verify front-page.php Is Recognized and Used

Action:

  1. Understand WordPress Template Hierarchy

    • front-page.php: Used for the site's home page when "Your homepage displays" is set to "Your latest posts" or a static page.

  2. Check WordPress Reading Settings

    • Go to Settings > Reading in the admin dashboard.
    • Your homepage displays:
      • If set to "Your latest posts", WordPress should use front-page.php.
      • If set to "A static page", assign the appropriate page.

  3. Assign a Static Front Page (If Desired)

    • If you want to use a static page:
      • Create a new page named "Home" (if not already created).
      • Go to Settings > Reading.
      • Set Homepage to "Home".
      • Ensure that "Posts page" is set to "— Select —" if you don't have a blog.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Incorrect reading settings may prevent front-page.php from being used.
  • Expected Outcome: Correct settings ensure front-page.php is applied to the home page.

4. Check for Errors in Theme Files

Action:

  1. Enable WordPress Debugging

    • In wp-config.php, set WP_DEBUG to true:

      php
      define( 'WP_DEBUG', true );

  2. Check for PHP Errors

    • Visit your website and see if any error messages are displayed.

  3. Review Theme Files for Syntax Errors

    • Open each PHP file in your theme.
    • Look for common syntax errors:
      • Missing semicolons (;)
      • Unclosed brackets ({, ()
      • Incorrect PHP tags (<?php, ?>)

  4. Use an IDE or Code Editor

    • Tools like Visual Studio Code or Sublime Text can highlight syntax errors.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: PHP errors can prevent templates from loading correctly.
  • Expected Outcome: Fixing errors allows WordPress to process your templates.

5. Ensure Templates Have Correct Template Names

Action:

  1. Check Template Files for Correct Headers

    • For page-adopt.php:

      php
      <?php
/* Template Name: Adopt Page */

    • For page-rehome.php:

      php
      <?php
/* Template Name: Rehome Page */

  2. Create Pages and Assign Templates

    • Go to Pages > Add New.
    • Create a page titled "Adopt".
      • In the Page Attributes section, select "Adopt Page" template.
      • Publish the page.
    • Repeat for "Rehome" page, selecting "Rehome Page" template.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: If pages aren't using the correct templates, they won't display as intended.
  • Expected Outcome: Assigning templates ensures pages use your custom code.

6. Verify Menu Setup

Action:

  1. Create and Assign Menus

    • Go to Appearance > Menus.
    • Create a new menu called "Primary Menu".
    • Add your pages (Home, Adopt, Rehome) to the menu.
    • Assign the menu to the Primary Menu location.

  2. Check header.php for wp_nav_menu Function

    • Ensure your header.php includes the navigation menu code:

      php
      <nav>
  <?php
  wp_nav_menu( array(
    'theme_location' => 'primary',
    'container' => '',
    'menu_class' => '',
  ) );
  ?>
</nav>

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Missing or incorrect menus can cause navigation issues.
  • Expected Outcome: Proper menu setup allows users to navigate your site.

7. Clear Caches and Disable Plugins (If Any)

Action:

  1. Clear Browser Cache

    • Hold Shift and click the Refresh button in your browser.

  2. Clear Server-Side Cache

    • If your hosting provider uses caching, clear it via the control panel.

  3. Disable Plugins

    • If any plugins are active, temporarily deactivate them to rule out conflicts.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Cached data can prevent recent changes from displaying.
  • Expected Outcome: Clearing caches ensures you're seeing the latest version of your site.

8. Confirm Site URL and Home URL Settings

Action:

  1. Go to Settings > General

    • Check WordPress Address (URL) and Site Address (URL).
    • Both should be set to https://tailsadoption.org.

  2. Update if Necessary

    • Ensure there are no typos or incorrect URLs.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Incorrect URLs can cause content and templates not to load properly.
  • Expected Outcome: Correct URLs ensure WordPress references the right paths.

9. Review the Content of front-page.php

Action:

  1. Ensure front-page.php Has Correct Code

    • It should contain the code provided earlier:

      php
      <?php
get_header();
?>

<main>
  <!-- Hero Section -->
  <section class="hero">
    <h1>Welcome to Tails Adoption</h1>
    <p>Your new best friend is waiting for you!</p>
    <a href="<?php echo site_url('/adopt'); ?>" class="btn">Find a Pet</a>
  </section>

  <!-- Additional sections can be added here -->
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

  2. Check for Syntax Errors

    • Make sure there are no missing <?php or ?> tags.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Incorrect code can prevent the template from rendering.
  • Expected Outcome: Correct code displays your custom home page content.

10. Check Theme's style.css Header

Action:

  1. Open style.css

    • Ensure the theme metadata is correct at the top of the file:

      css
      /*
Theme Name: Tails Adoption Theme
Theme URI: https://tailsadoption.org/
Description: Custom theme for Tails Adoption
Author: Your Name
Author URI: https://tailsadoption.org/
Version: 1.0.0
Text Domain: tailsadoption
*/

  2. Verify Theme Name

    • The Theme Name should match the name displayed in the WordPress admin.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Incorrect theme headers can prevent WordPress from recognizing the theme.
  • Expected Outcome: Correct theme metadata ensures proper recognition and activation.

11. Ensure WordPress Recognizes Your Templates

Action:

  1. Flush Permalinks

    • Go to Settings > Permalinks.
    • Click Save Changes without making any changes.

  2. Check Template Hierarchy

    • For the home page, WordPress uses front-page.php if it exists.
    • For custom pages, ensure the template names are correctly specified.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Sometimes WordPress needs to refresh its permalink structure.
  • Expected Outcome: Flushing permalinks can resolve routing issues.

12. Verify File Permissions

Action:

  1. Check File Permissions via FTP

    • Files should typically have permissions set to 644.
    • Directories should have permissions set to 755.

  2. Adjust Permissions If Necessary

    • Use your FTP client to change permissions.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Incorrect permissions can prevent WordPress from accessing theme files.
  • Expected Outcome: Correct permissions ensure WordPress can read and execute your theme files.

13. Test with a Default Theme

Action:

  1. Activate a Default WordPress Theme

    • Go to Appearance > Themes.
    • Activate a default theme like Twenty Twenty-One.

  2. Check Website Display

    • Visit your site to see if it displays correctly with the default theme.

  3. Switch Back to Your Custom Theme

    • Reactivate Tails Adoption Theme.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: This helps determine if the issue is with your theme or WordPress in general.
  • Expected Outcome: If the default theme works, the issue is likely within your custom theme.

14. Reinstall WordPress Core Files (As a Last Resort)

Action:

  1. Backup Your Site

    • Before making major changes, back up your database and files.

  2. Reinstall WordPress Core

    • In the admin dashboard, go to Dashboard > Updates.
    • Click Re-install Now under the WordPress version.

Explanation:

  • Symptom Addressed: Corrupted core files can cause unexpected behavior.
  • Expected Outcome: Reinstalling core files can resolve underlying issues.

Summary of Actions

  • Activate Your Custom Theme in the WordPress admin dashboard.
  • Ensure Theme Files Are Correctly Placed in /wp-content/themes/tailsadoption/.
  • Assign Templates to Pages and set up your menu for navigation.
  • Check WordPress Settings to ensure they align with your theme's templates.
  • Fix Any Errors in your theme's code by reviewing and testing.
  • Clear Caches to ensure you're viewing the latest version of your site.

Next Steps

  1. Follow the troubleshooting steps outlined above.

  2. Document any changes you make and note their effects.

  3. If issues persist, provide specific error messages or behaviors, and I'll assist further.

Additional Tips

  • Develop Locally: Consider setting up a local development environment to test changes before applying them to your live site.

  • Use Version Control: Implement Git or another version control system to track changes to your theme files.

  • Seek Professional Assistance: If you're uncomfortable making these changes or if issues persist, consider consulting a professional WordPress developer.

Please let me know how it goes after trying these steps or if you need clarification on any of them. I'm here to help you get your website displaying correctly!

You said:
When I clicked on Themes, I found my theme "Tails Adoption Child Theme" with a banner stating "theme broken. Reverting to default theme". When I clicked on the theme to find issues, there was a message saying that the index.php file could not be found. So, I have changed the name of the homepage template from "front-page.php" to "index.php". Also, I followed the steps you provided in "Ensure Templates Have Correct Template Names" and that was a success, thank you. Now, all the links and pages are functioning properly. we are ready to give an overhaul to the style. Based on your knowledge of award-winning CSS designs, For all webpages, make edits to various files to give the entire site a similar award-winning look. This will require some images, but you can assume all images necessary for this aesthetics overhaul are already on my system and they are ready to be filled into proper placeholders in the code and into the server folders for access, so you can just place the placeholders in the code with the "#####"s we discussed and include after the code details on the kind of image that is meant to go there, and provide in which folder the images should be saved on the server. Remember to include a few images of pets in the placeholders of this style overhaul, to make the theme match the website's mission. Update the font to something more contemporary and in style in the 2020s. Fix the font size of various text across all the webpages and ensure links are cascading properly. Ensure text is aligned center, left, right, or with respect to an image where appropriate. For the home page, Use animations that glide certain text in or make it fade into existence on the homepage. Some text for filling in the home page: "Tails Adoption was founded to offer a compassionate alternative to traditional pet adoption processes. By removing the barriers of conflict, cost, and shelter logistics, we connect loving families with pets in need, ensuring no animal is abandoned or left behind." "Our mission is to make pet adoption accessible and stress-free, reducing the need for shelters and minimizing the costs for adopters. We rely on community support and innovative online platforms to save lives, one pet at a time." Also include at the bottom of the home page a card titled "Contact us", fill it with "Email: tailsadoptioninfo@gmail.com", "Phone: 850-333-5046", and also provide a small form that allows users to fill out their name, their email, and a message, that, once submitted, send the info and the message to the email "tailsadoptioninfo@gmail.com". feel free to fill in text elsewhere in similar writing style and ideas to what I have provided here. We can also go ahead and make some links to a "Donate", "Events",

Absolutely! Let's enhance your website's design to give it a modern, award-winning look. We'll update your CSS, HTML, and JavaScript files to incorporate contemporary fonts, responsive layouts, animations, and placeholders for images. I'll provide complete code blocks for each file that needs updating, with comments and explanations to guide you through the changes.

Overview

We'll focus on the following aspects:

  1. Update Fonts and Typography
  2. Enhance Layout and Styling
  3. Add Animations to the Home Page
  4. Include Provided Text Content
  5. Add a "Contact Us" Section with a Contact Form
  6. Use Placeholders for Images
  7. Add Links to "Donate" and "Events" Pages

1. Update Fonts and Typography

We'll use Google Fonts to incorporate modern, stylish fonts.

Update functions.php to Enqueue Google Fonts

Add the following code to your functions.php to enqueue the Google Fonts:

php
<?php
// ... existing code ...

// Enqueue Google Fonts
function tailsadoption_enqueue_styles() {
    wp_enqueue_style( 'tailsadoption-style', get_stylesheet_uri() );

    // Enqueue Google Fonts
    wp_enqueue_style( 'tailsadoption-google-fonts', 'https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Montserrat:wght@400;700&family=Roboto:wght@400;500&display=swap', false );
}
add_action( 'wp_enqueue_scripts', 'tailsadoption_enqueue_styles' );

// ... existing code ...
?>

Explanation:

  • We're adding Montserrat and Roboto fonts, which are popular and contemporary.
  • Montserrat will be used for headings, and Roboto for body text.

Update style.css to Use the New Fonts

Modify your style.css to incorporate the new fonts.

css
/* ... existing CSS ... */

/* Variables */
:root {
  --primary-color: #5A9BD5;
  --secondary-color: #A8D08D;
  --accent-color: #FFD966;
  --text-color: #333;
  --background-color: #fff;
  --font-primary: 'Montserrat', sans-serif;
  --font-secondary: 'Roboto', sans-serif;
}

/* Body Styles */
body {
  font-family: var(--font-secondary);
  color: var(--text-color);
  background-color: var(--background-color);
  line-height: 1.6;
}

/* Headings */
h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 {
  font-family: var(--font-primary);
  color: var(--text-color);
  margin-bottom: 20px;
}

/* Paragraphs */
p {
  font-size: 18px;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
}

/* Links */
a {
  color: var(--primary-color);
  text-decoration: none;
}

a:hover {
  text-decoration: underline;
}

/* ... rest of your CSS ... */

2. Enhance Layout and Styling

We'll update the CSS to improve the layout, ensure proper alignment, and enhance the visual appeal.

Update style.css with Improved Styling

Add or replace the following styles in your style.css:

css
/* Container */
.container {
  width: 90%;
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
}

/* Header Styles */
header {
  background-color: var(--secondary-color);
  padding: 20px 0;
}

header .container {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: space-between;
}

header .logo img {
  max-width: 180px;
}

header nav ul {
  list-style: none;
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
}

header nav ul li {
  margin-left: 30px;
}

header nav a {
  font-family: var(--font-primary);
  font-weight: 700;
  color: var(--text-color);
  text-decoration: none;
  font-size: 18px;
}

header nav a:hover {
  color: var(--primary-color);
}

/* Hero Section */
.hero {
  background-image: url('#####'); /* Placeholder for background image */
  background-size: cover;
  background-position: center;
  color: #fff;
  text-align: center;
  padding: 150px 20px;
  position: relative;
}

.hero::after {
  content: '';
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
}

.hero h1 {
  font-size: 64px;
  font-weight: 700;
  z-index: 1;
  position: relative;
}

.hero p {
  font-size: 24px;
  margin-bottom: 40px;
  z-index: 1;
  position: relative;
}

/* Buttons */
.btn {
  background-color: var(--primary-color);
  color: #fff;
  padding: 15px 30px;
  text-decoration: none;
  border-radius: 5px;
  font-size: 18px;
  display: inline-block;
}

.btn:hover {
  background-color: darken(var(--primary-color), 10%);
}

/* Sections */
section {
  padding: 80px 0;
}

section h2 {
  font-size: 36px;
  text-align: center;
  margin-bottom: 60px;
}

/* About Us Section */
.about-us .container {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
}

.about-us .text {
  flex: 1;
  padding: 20px;
}

.about-us .image {
  flex: 1;
  padding: 20px;
  text-align: center;
}

.about-us .image img {
  max-width: 100%;
  border-radius: 10px;
}

/* Contact Us Section */
.contact-us {
  background-color: var(--secondary-color);
}

.contact-us .container {
  max-width: 600px;
  text-align: center;
}

.contact-us form {
  margin-top: 40px;
}

.contact-us label {
  display: block;
  text-align: left;
  margin-bottom: 5px;
  font-weight: 500;
}

.contact-us input,
.contact-us textarea {
  width: 100%;
  padding: 15px;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
  border: none;
  border-radius: 5px;
}

.contact-us input[type="submit"] {
  background-color: var(--primary-color);
  color: #fff;
  cursor: pointer;
}

.contact-us input[type="submit"]:hover {
  background-color: darken(var(--primary-color), 10%);
}

/* Footer Styles */
footer {
  background-color: var(--accent-color);
  text-align: center;
  padding: 20px 0;
}

footer p {
  color: var(--text-color);
}

/* Responsive Design */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  header .container {
    flex-direction: column;
  }

  header nav ul {
    flex-direction: column;
    margin-top: 20px;
  }

  header nav ul li {
    margin-left: 0;
    margin-bottom: 10px;
  }

  .about-us .container {
    flex-direction: column;
  }

  .hero h1 {
    font-size: 48px;
  }

  .hero p {
    font-size: 20px;
  }
}

/* ... rest of your CSS ... */

Note: Replace '#####' in background-image: url('#####'); with the actual path to your background image, e.g., url('images/hero-bg.jpg');.

Add Images to Your Theme

  • Background Image for Hero Section:
    • Image Type: An inspiring image of happy pets or a pet with its new owner.
    • Save To: /wp-content/themes/tailsadoption/images/hero-bg.jpg
  • About Us Image:
    • Image Type: A group of pets or a compassionate scene representing your mission.
    • Save To: /wp-content/themes/tailsadoption/images/about-us.jpg

3. Add Animations to the Home Page

We'll use CSS animations for text effects and JavaScript for scroll animations.

Update style.css with Animation Styles

Add the following CSS to define animations:

css
/* Animations */
@keyframes fadeInUp {
  from {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(40px);
  }
  to {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
}

.animate-fadeInUp {
  animation: fadeInUp 1s ease forwards;
}

.hero h1,
.hero p,
.hero .btn {
  opacity: 0;
}

.hero h1 {
  animation-delay: 0.2s;
}

.hero p {
  animation-delay: 0.4s;
}

.hero .btn {
  animation-delay: 0.6s;
}

Update main.js to Trigger Animations

Create or update your main.js file to add animation classes when the page loads.

javascript
// main.js

document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
  // Add animation classes to hero elements
  const heroElements = document.querySelectorAll('.hero h1, .hero p, .hero .btn');
  heroElements.forEach(function(element) {
    element.classList.add('animate-fadeInUp');
  });

  // Additional JavaScript for interactivity can be added here
});

Note: Ensure you enqueue main.js in your functions.php:

php
// Enqueue scripts and styles
function tailsadoption_scripts() {
    wp_enqueue_style( 'tailsadoption-style', get_stylesheet_uri() );

    // Enqueue Google Fonts
    wp_enqueue_style( 'tailsadoption-google-fonts', 'https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Montserrat:wght@400;700&family=Roboto:wght@400;500&display=swap', false );

    // Enqueue main.js
    wp_enqueue_script( 'tailsadoption-script', get_template_directory_uri() . '/main.js', array(), null, true );
}
add_action( 'wp_enqueue_scripts', 'tailsadoption_scripts' );

4. Include Provided Text Content

We'll incorporate the text you provided into the home page.

Update index.php (formerly front-page.php)

Replace the content of your index.php with the following code:

php
<?php
get_header();
?>

<main>
  <!-- Hero Section -->
  <section class="hero">
    <div class="container">
      <h1>Welcome to Tails Adoption</h1>
      <p>Your new best friend is waiting for you!</p>
      <a href="<?php echo site_url('/adopt'); ?>" class="btn">Find a Pet</a>
    </div>
  </section>

  <!-- About Us Section -->
  <section class="about-us">
    <div class="container">
      <div class="text">
        <h2>About Us</h2>
        <p>Tails Adoption was founded to offer a compassionate alternative to traditional pet adoption processes. By removing the barriers of conflict, cost, and shelter logistics, we connect loving families with pets in need, ensuring no animal is abandoned or left behind.</p>
        <p>Our mission is to make pet adoption accessible and stress-free, reducing the need for shelters and minimizing the costs for adopters. We rely on community support and innovative online platforms to save lives, one pet at a time.</p>
        <a href="<?php echo site_url('/about'); ?>" class="btn">Learn More</a>
      </div>
      <div class="image">
        <img src="#####" alt="About Us Image">
      </div>
    </div>
  </section>

  <!-- Contact Us Section -->
  <section class="contact-us">
    <div class="container">
      <h2>Contact Us</h2>
      <p>Email: <a href="mailto:tailsadoptioninfo@gmail.com">tailsadoptioninfo@gmail.com</a></p>
      <p>Phone: <a href="tel:8503335046">850-333-5046</a></p>

      <!-- Contact Form -->
      <form action="" method="post">
        <?php wp_nonce_field( 'contact_form', 'contact_nonce' ); ?>

        <label for="contact_name">Name</label>
        <input type="text" name="contact_name" id="contact_name" required>

        <label for="contact_email">Email</label>
        <input type="email" name="contact_email" id="contact_email" required>

        <label for="contact_message">Message</label>
        <textarea name="contact_message" id="contact_message" rows="6" required></textarea>

        <input type="submit" name="submit_contact" value="Send Message">
      </form>

      <?php
      // Handle form submission
      if ( isset( $_POST['submit_contact'] ) ) {
          if ( ! isset( $_POST['contact_nonce'] ) || ! wp_verify_nonce( $_POST['contact_nonce'], 'contact_form' ) ) {
              echo '<p>Error: Invalid form submission. Please try again.</p>';
          } else {
              $name    = sanitize_text_field( $_POST['contact_name'] );
              $email   = sanitize_email( $_POST['contact_email'] );
              $message = sanitize_textarea_field( $_POST['contact_message'] );

              $to      = 'tailsadoptioninfo@gmail.com';
              $subject = 'New Contact Form Submission';
              $body    = "Name: $name\nEmail: $email\n\nMessage:\n$message";
              $headers = array( 'Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8', "From: $name <$email>" );

              if ( wp_mail( $to, $subject, $body, $headers ) ) {
                  echo '<p>Thank you for your message. We will get back to you soon!</p>';
              } else {
                  echo '<p>Error: Unable to send your message. Please try again later.</p>';
              }
          }
      }
      ?>

    </div>
  </section>
</main>

<?php get_footer(); ?>

Notes:

  • Placeholders for Images:
    • About Us Image:
      • Replace src="#####" with src="<?php echo get_template_directory_uri(); ?>/images/about-us.jpg" after adding the image to your theme.
  • Contact Form Handling:
    • The form includes nonce verification for security.
    • Uses wp_mail() to send the email.

5. Add Links to "Donate" and "Events" Pages

Update Navigation Menu in header.php

Ensure your navigation menu includes links to the new pages.

php
<header>
  <div class="container">
    <div class="logo">
      <a href="<?php echo home_url(); ?>">
        <img src="<?php echo get_template_directory_uri(); ?>/images/logo.png" alt="Tails Adoption">
      </a>
    </div>
    <nav>
      <?php
      wp_nav_menu( array(
        'theme_location' => 'primary',
        'container' => '',
        'menu_class' => '',
      ) );
      ?>
    </nav>
  </div>
</header>

Note: Ensure that your menu in the WordPress admin includes "Donate" and "Events" pages.

Create the "Donate" and "Events" Pages

  1. Create Pages in WordPress Admin:

    • Go to Pages > Add New.
    • Create a page titled "Donate" and add relevant content.
    • Create a page titled "Events" and add upcoming events.

  2. Add Pages to the Menu:

    • Go to Appearance > Menus.
    • Add the "Donate" and "Events" pages to your Primary Menu.

6. Ensure Text Alignment and Proper Cascading of Links

We've updated the CSS to ensure text is aligned appropriately and links are styled consistently.

  • Text Alignment:

    • Hero section text is centered.
    • About Us section text is left-aligned with the image on the right.
    • Contact Us section text is centered.

  • Links:

    • All links use the primary color and have a hover effect.
    • Buttons are styled consistently across the site.

7. Include Images of Pets

Placeholders for images have been included in the code.

Images Needed:

  1. Logo Image:

    • File Name: logo.png
    • Save To: /wp-content/themes/tailsadoption/images/logo.png
    • Description: Your site's logo.

  2. Hero Background Image:

    • File Name: hero-bg.jpg
    • Save To: /wp-content/themes/tailsadoption/images/hero-bg.jpg
    • Description: Inspiring image of pets or pets with owners.

  3. About Us Image:

    • File Name: about-us.jpg
    • Save To: /wp-content/themes/tailsadoption/images/about-us.jpg
    • Description: Image representing your mission or a group of pets.

Ensure you replace the ##### placeholders in the code with the actual image paths as shown above.

8. Additional Text Content

Feel free to add more sections or content in a similar writing style. For example:

Add a "How It Works" Section

Update index.php to include:

php
<!-- How It Works Section -->
<section class="how-it-works">
  <div class="container">
    <h2>How It Works</h2>
    <div class="steps">
      <div class="step">
        <h3>1. Sign Up</h3>
        <p>Create an account to start your adoption journey or to rehome your pet.</p>
      </div>
      <div class="step">
        <h3>2. Browse Pets</h3>
        <p>Explore the profiles of pets available for adoption and find your perfect match.</p>
      </div>
      <div class="step">
        <h3>3. Connect</h3>
        <p>Contact the pet owner directly to arrange adoption details.</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</section>

Add corresponding styles to style.css:

css
/* How It Works Section */
.how-it-works {
  background-color: #f9f9f9;
}

.how-it-works .steps {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: space-between;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
}

.how-it-works .step {
  flex: 1;
  min-width: 250px;
  margin: 20px;
  text-align: center;
}

.how-it-works .step h3 {
  font-size: 28px;
  margin-bottom: 15px;
}

.how-it-works .step p {
  font-size: 16px;
}

9. Finalizing the Changes

Ensure that:

  • All images are uploaded to the correct folders in your theme.
  • CSS and JavaScript files are properly linked and enqueued.
  • All code changes are saved and uploaded to your server.
  • Test the website to verify that everything displays and functions as intended.

Conclusion

By updating your theme files with the code provided, your website will have a modern, engaging design that aligns with your mission. The use of contemporary fonts, appealing images, animations, and thoughtful content will enhance user experience and encourage engagement.

Feel free to let me know if you need any further assistance or have questions about implementing these changes. I'm here to help!

You said:
Finalize and concatenate all the css code into one code block so I can copy and paste it all at once

Certainly! Below is the complete style.css file for your Tails Adoption Theme. This CSS incorporates modern design principles, contemporary fonts, responsive layouts, animations, and placeholders for images. Follow the instructions below to ensure everything is set up correctly.

css
/*
Theme Name: Tails Adoption Theme
Theme URI: https://tailsadoption.org/
Description: Custom theme for Tails Adoption
Author: Your Name
Author URI: https://tailsadoption.org/
Version: 1.0.0
License: GNU General Public License v2 or later
License URI: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html
Text Domain: tailsadoption
*/

/* Reset */
* {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  box-sizing: border-box;
}

/* Variables */
:root {
  --primary-color: #5A9BD5;
  --secondary-color: #A8D08D;
  --accent-color: #FFD966;
  --text-color: #333;
  --background-color: #fff;
  --font-primary: 'Montserrat', sans-serif;
  --font-secondary: 'Roboto', sans-serif;
}

/* Import Google Fonts */
@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Montserrat:wght@400;700&family=Roboto:wght@400;500&display=swap');

/* Body Styles */
body {
  font-family: var(--font-secondary);
  color: var(--text-color);
  background-color: var(--background-color);
  line-height: 1.6;
}

/* Container */
.container {
  width: 90%;
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
}

/* Header Styles */
header {
  background-color: var(--secondary-color);
  padding: 20px 0;
}

header .container {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: space-between;
}

header .logo img {
  max-width: 180px;
}

header nav ul {
  list-style: none;
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
}

header nav ul li {
  margin-left: 30px;
}

header nav a {
  font-family: var(--font-primary);
  font-weight: 700;
  color: var(--text-color);
  text-decoration: none;
  font-size: 18px;
}

header nav a:hover {
  color: var(--primary-color);
}

/* Hero Section */
.hero {
  background-image: url('images/hero-bg.jpg'); /* Replace 'hero-bg.jpg' with your actual background image */
  background-size: cover;
  background-position: center;
  color: #fff;
  text-align: center;
  padding: 150px 20px;
  position: relative;
}

.hero::after {
  content: '';
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
}

.hero .container {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 1;
}

.hero h1 {
  font-family: var(--font-primary);
  font-size: 64px;
  font-weight: 700;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
  animation: fadeInUp 1s ease forwards;
  opacity: 0;
}

.hero p {
  font-size: 24px;
  margin-bottom: 40px;
  animation: fadeInUp 1s ease forwards;
  animation-delay: 0.4s;
  opacity: 0;
}

.hero .btn {
  background-color: var(--primary-color);
  color: #fff;
  padding: 15px 30px;
  text-decoration: none;
  border-radius: 5px;
  font-size: 18px;
  display: inline-block;
  animation: fadeInUp 1s ease forwards;
  animation-delay: 0.6s;
  opacity: 0;
}

.hero .btn:hover {
